required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: MenB Vaccine: Implementation Via Information, Empowerment and Accessibility
clinical_study.official_title: Establishing and Evaluating a School and University Campus-Based Approach to Implementing Serogroup B Meningococcal (MenB) Disease Recommendations in Older Adolescents and Young Adults.

brief_summary.textblock: As part of an effort to increase MenB vaccine uptake among adolescents and young adults, study teams will conduct qualitative research to maximize the effectiveness of nationally recommended MenB educational materials. In this study, Study Teams will assess local barriers to MenB vaccination by conducting focus groups with parents, students, and health care professionals.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants (parents of 16-23 year old teens and young adults, high school and college students 16-23 years old, and health care professionals for 16-23 year olds) will be asked to share their thoughts on the completeness of nationally recommended and publicly available MenB vaccine educational materials in addressing hesitations to receipt of the MenB vaccine. There is no risk in discussing reactions to educational materials. The biggest risk is disclosure of information provided in the study which will be reactions to health-promotion material.

primary_outcome.measure: Vaccine uptake in adolescents and young adults - Awareness
primary_outcome.description: Lykert scale 1-5 five being more aware

primary_outcome.measure: Vaccine uptake in adolescents and young adults - Education
primary_outcome.description: Lykert scale 1-5 five being more educated

primary_outcome.measure: Vaccine uptake in adolescents and young adults - Empowerment
primary_outcome.description: Lykert scale 1-5 five being more empowered

primary_outcome.measure: Vaccine uptake in adolescents and young adults - Accessibility
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants who received the vaccine after the program

secondary_outcome.measure: Knowledge about MenB vaccine efficacy, potential benefits, possible side effects
secondary_outcome.description: Pre- and Post- intervention surveys to assess acquired knowledge
Pre- and Post- intervention surveys to assess attitudes, perceptions and decision-making re vaccine acceptance

arm_group.description: Youth between the ages beteen ages 13-18 will be offered awareness, education, empowerment and accessibility intervention components.
Age between 18-23 will be offered awareness, education, empowerment and accessibility intervention components.
parents of adolescents and young adults will be offered awareness, education, and accessibility intervention components.

intervention.description: Awareness: Conduct an awareness campaign throughout Alachua County to alert the community in general to the significance of Serogroup B meningococcal disease in the United States. To inform the material included in the awareness campaign and the education materials, semi-structured interviews with members for each of the key stakeholder groups: students, parents, and medical practitioners will be conducted.

Education: This component will be both web-based and in-person to meet the individual needs of the learners. There will be parent and a student (18-23 years old) version of the educational curriculum. National resources of patient -focused materials and guidelines will be adapted. There will be pre- and post-education surveys to assess knowledge and vaccine decision-making.

Empowerment: A guided program for adolescents and young adults on "Decision-Making for your Health" will be offered on the vaccination days to assist youth in assessing and utilizing health information to guide their personal decision-making for vaccines.

Accessibility: MenB vaccine will be offer on the high school and university campuses through a collaborative program between the local schools, university and department of health. We will offer students booster shots of Men ACWY and HPV at the same time. All vaccines will be offered free of charge. Each vaccine administered will be recorded in Florida SHOTS.

study_pop.textblock: In this study, we will assess the acceptability and usefulness of nationally recommended MenB vaccine educational materials with focus groups of parents, students, and health care providers. We will use information gathered during focus groups to develop supplementary content to address parent and student concerns during the intervention phase of the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must be able to provide informed consent or assent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to provide informed consent or assent
